snippet: Journalists, protesters, officials and ideologues have swamped tiny Burns, Ore., and its residents have responded by offering couches, meals and coffee.
abstract: Burns, Ore, town that was site of Malheur National Wildlife Refuge occupation, welcomed influx of protesters, journalists and officials interested in the story; armed occupation of wildlife preserve has ended and residents struggle to retain small town charm in light of controversial events.

byline.contributor: Julie Turkewitz contributed reporting from Princeton, Ore.

lead_paragraph: Journalists, protesters, officials and ideologues have swamped tiny Burns, Ore., and its residents have responded by offering couches, meals and coffee.

headline.main: An Unwanted Circus Descends, and an Oregon Town Strives to Stay Kind
headline.print_headline: A Circus Descends, and an Oregon Town Strives to Remain Kind
